bio: Nattapong Thongphueak is a renowned Thai chef with 15 years of experience in cooking traditional Thai cuisine. He specializes in curries and stir-fried dishes, and has created over 80 recipes that are loved by both locals and tourists alike. With over 1200 likes on social media, he is known for his unique blend of flavors and creative presentation of his dishes.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Boil water with lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. 2. Add chili peppers and shrimp. 3. Season with fish sauce and lime juice. 4. Serve hot.

1. Soak rice noodles in water. 2. Stir-fry shrimp, tofu, and eggs in a pan. 3. Add soaked noodles and bean sprouts. 4. Season with tamarind sauce, fish sauce, and sugar. 5. Serve hot with lime and peanuts.

1. Fry green curry paste in a pan. 2. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. 3. Add chicken and bamboo shoots. 4. Simmer until chicken is cooked. 5. Season with fish sauce and sugar. 6. Add basil leaves and serve hot with rice.

bio: Nongkran Daks is a skilled Thai chef with 12 years of experience in cooking authentic Thai dishes. She is particularly known for her expertise in cooking seafood, and has created over 60 recipes that showcase the delicate and nuanced flavors of the sea. With over 1000 likes on social media, she is a popular choice for those who love seafood and traditional Thai cuisine.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Boil water and add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. 2. Add shrimp and cook until pink. 3. Add chili paste and fish sauce to taste. 4. Serve hot.
1. Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft. 2. Fry shrimp and scallions in a pan. 3. Add bean sprouts and rice noodles. 4. Stir in tamarind sauce, sugar, and fish sauce. 5. Serve hot.

1. Fry chicken in a pan. 2. Add green curry paste and fry until fragrant. 3. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. 4. Add bamboo shoots and eggplant. 5. Simmer until vegetables are cooked. 6. Serve hot.

bio: Sarocha Kuhn is a talented Thai chef with 8 years of experience in cooking delicious and healthy Thai dishes. She specializes in vegetarian and vegan cuisine, and has created over 40 recipes that are not only delicious, but also packed with nutrients. With over 800 likes on social media, she is a popular choice for those who are looking for healthy and sustainable Thai dishes.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Shred green papaya into thin strips. 2. Cut cherry tomatoes in half. 3. Boil green beans until cooked. 4. Combine papaya, tomatoes, and green beans in a bowl. 5. Season with fish sauce, lime juice, and sugar. 6. Top with crushed peanuts. 7. Serve cold.
1. Cut chicken into thin strips. 2. Marinate chicken in lemongrass, garlic, and coconut milk for at least 30 minutes. 3. Skewer chicken and grill until cooked. 4. Serve with peanut sauce.

1. Peel and dice green papaya. 2. Fry shallots and ginger in a pot. 3. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. 4. Add diced green papaya and simmer until soft. 5. Add coconut milk and heat until warm. 6. Serve hot.

bio: Piyakorn Saengjan is a skilled Thai chef with 10 years of experience in cooking traditional Thai cuisine. He specializes in grilled and roasted dishes, and has created over 50 recipes that showcase the bold and flavorful taste of Thai cuisine. With over 900 likes on social media, he is a popular choice for those who love the smoky and savory taste of grilled and roasted dishes.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Fry beef in a pan. 2. Add massaman curry paste and fry until fragrant. 3. Add water and bring to a boil. 4. Add potatoes and onions. 5. Simmer until vegetables are cooked. 6. Top with crushed peanuts. 7. Serve hot.
1. Grill chicken until cooked. 2. Shred green papaya and carrots. 3. Cut long beans into small pieces. 4. Mix vegetables together. 5. Dress with lime dressing. 6. Serve with grilled chicken.
1. Fry chicken in a pan. 2. Boil water and add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves. 3. Add chicken and coconut milk. 4. Simmer until chicken is cooked. 5. Serve hot.

bio: Phatchara Pirapak is a talented Thai chef with 7 years of experience in cooking delicious and innovative Thai dishes. She specializes in fusion cuisine, and has created over 30 recipes that combine Thai ingredients with flavors from other cuisines around the world. With over 700 likes on social media, she is known for her creative and unique take on Thai cuisine.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Fry beef in a pan. 2. Add panang curry paste and fry until fragrant. 3. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. 4. Add kaffir lime leaves and bell peppers. 5. Simmer until vegetables are cooked. 6. Serve hot.
1. Fry chicken in a pan. 2. Add curry powder and fry until fragrant. 3. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. 4. Serve with cooked egg noodles and pickled mustard greens on top.
1. Fry garlic and chilies in a pan. 2. Add ground pork and fry until cooked. 3. Add soy sauce and holy basil. 4. Serve hot with rice.

bio: Sathaporn Khongsawatkiat is a highly skilled Thai chef with 20 years of experience in cooking authentic Thai cuisine. He is known for his expertise in cooking spicy dishes, and has created over 100 recipes that showcase the bold and fiery flavors of Thai cuisine. With over 1500 likes on social media, he is a popular choice for those who love the heat and intensity of spicy Thai dishes.

recipes.cookingMethod: 1. Boil water in a pot. 2. Add lemon grass, kaffir lime leaves, and galangal. 3. Add shrimp and bird's eye chilies. 4. Serve hot.

1. Fry chicken in a pan. 2. Add green curry paste and fry until fragrant. 3. Add coconut milk and bring to a boil. 4. Add eggplants and sweet basil leaves. 5. Simmer until vegetables are cooked. 6. Serve hot.
1. Soak rice noodles in warm water until soft. 2. Fry shrimp and tofu in a pan. 3. Add noodles and bean sprouts. 4. Add tamarind sauce and fry until the noodles are cooked. 5. Serve hot.
